title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A lawyer in the Depression-era South defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children learn about prejudice.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the future under a totalitarian regime.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The romantic clash between the opinionated Elizabeth Bennet and her proud beau, Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York, narrates his two days of angst and alienation.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: Robert Langdon investigates a murder in the Louvre that leads to a religious mystery protected by a secret society.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Frodo Baggins must destroy the One Ring to defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy, travels in search of a worldly treasure.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Four siblings step through a wardrobe into the magical land of Narnia.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: Farm animals rebel against their human farmer, hoping to create a society where they can be equal.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The story of a young governess and her love for her mysterious employer, Mr. Rochester.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: Scarlett O'Hara's struggle to survive and keep her land during the American Civil War.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A future society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society managed by genetic engineering, brainwashing, and drugs.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
description: A pig named Wilbur is saved from slaughter by a spider named Charlotte.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A wealthy boy and the son of his father's servant grow up in Afghanistan.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl in Nazi Germany steals books and shares them with others.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A pilot stranded in the desert meets a young prince fallen to Earth from a tiny asteroid.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: In a theocratic future, women are subjugated and used for reproduction.

title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton
description: Genetically engineered dinosaurs run amok at an island theme park.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two cancer-afflicted teenagers meet at a support group and fall in love.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family stays in an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence drives the father to violence.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: Arthur Dent is rescued from Earth moments before its destruction to make way for a bypass.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: The intense and tragic love story of Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: The lives of the four March sisters as they grow up in Civil War era America.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
description: A young girl falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world of anthropomorphic creatures.
